b'Because in America, everyone\xe2\x80\x99s voice matters. And that\xe2\x80\x99s still the truth, no matter what some folks want you to believe.'

b'If you live in Georgia, make sure you vote for @ReverendWarnock and @Ossoff in tomorrow\xe2\x80\x99s U.S. Senate runoffs\xe2\x80\x94and make sure everybody you know does the same. If you\xe2\x80\x99ve already received a mail-in ballot, take it to a drop-box or vote in person at your polling place tomorrow.'

b'So if Georgians elect @ReverendWarnock and @Ossoff, we\xe2\x80\x99ll take another step toward cleaning up the mess of the past four years. And we\xe2\x80\x99ll send a message to any politician who puts themselves and their ambition above our system of self-government.'
b'These runoffs will decide whether President-Elect Biden has a Senate that will work with him rather than just obstruct him at every turn.'

b'Tomorrow\xe2\x80\x99s runoffs in Georgia will decide whether the U.S. Senate is run by those who\xe2\x80\x99ve shown their willingness to tear down our democracy\xe2\x80\x94or whether it\xe2\x80\x99ll be run by those who will actually get to work on the monumental challenges before us.'
b'This is why we can\xe2\x80\x99t just vote for President and think that our job is done.'

b'And this is just unconscionable at a time when a staggering number of Americans are dying every day from a virus that was downplayed for far too long. It\xe2\x80\x99s unconscionable to focus on overturning an election rather than helping struggling families or distributing a vaccine.'

b'Your vote is your voice. It\xe2\x80\x99s your power. And right now, from the President of the United States on down, we\xe2\x80\x99re seeing and hearing just how desperate some are to take that power away. They want us to believe that their pride is more important than our democracy.'

b'Van, thank you for expressing the sorrow and relief that we all feel. My hope is that those who hoped for a different outcome will take a moment to empathize with the pain so many of us have felt over the past four years. https://t.co/eqL1szT1Iz'
b'My warmest congratulations again to Joe and Jill, Kamala and Doug\xe2\x80\x94and each of you who stepped up when your country needed you.'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99ve got to promise each other that our focus in this election won\xe2\x80\x99t be an anomaly, but the rule. That\xe2\x80\x99s how we can not only feel this way right now, but in the months and years ahead. It\xe2\x80\x99s the only way we\xe2\x80\x99ll build a nation worthy of our children.'

b'So it\xe2\x80\x99s up to us to stay engaged and informed, to keep speaking out and marching on. We\xe2\x80\x99ve got to vote in even greater numbers in the upcoming Senate runoffs in Georgia\xe2\x80\x94and every state and local election going forward.'

b'We see now the reality that we can\xe2\x80\x99t take even the tiniest part of our democracy for granted. Every single vote must count \xe2\x80\x94 and every single one of us must vote. And as a country, we should be making it easier, not harder to cast a ballot.'

b'But we\xe2\x80\x99ve also got to recognize that the path to progress will always be uphill. We\xe2\x80\x99ll always have to scrape and crawl up toward that mountaintop. And two years from now, four years from now, there will once again be no margin for error.'

b'Let\xe2\x80\x99s remember that tens of millions of people voted for the status quo, even when it meant supporting lies, hate, chaos, and division. We\xe2\x80\x99ve got a lot of work to do to reach out to these folks in the years ahead and connect with them on what unites us.'

b'And after we celebrate \xe2\x80\x94 and we should all take a moment to exhale after everything we\xe2\x80\x99ve been through \xe2\x80\x94 let\xe2\x80\x99s remember that this is just a beginning. It\xe2\x80\x99s a first step. Voting in one election isn\xe2\x80\x99t a magic wand, and neither is winning one.'

b'Thank you to all of you who poured every ounce of your hope and determination into this democracy over these past four years, registering voters, getting them to the polls, keeping folks informed. More votes were cast in this election than ever before. It\xe2\x80\x99s because of you.'

b'Because the drama of the past few days has only emphasized what\xe2\x80\x99s at stake in this election, from the coronavirus to a constant drumbeat of fear, division, and chaos that\xe2\x80\x99s threatening to spiral out of control.'

b'The truth is, the events of the past few days are a bracing reminder of the tragedy that has been this administration\xe2\x80\x99s response to this crisis.'

b'#Classof2020, and every one of you out there using your voice to fight for justice, you all are exactly what we need right now\xe2\x80\x94and for the years and decades to come. I love you all. I believe in you all. This is your time. @reachhigher'

b'This is how you can finish the work that the generations before you started. By staying open and hopeful, even through tough times. Even through discomfort and pain. Channel your feelings into activism and into this democracy that was designed to respond to those who vote.'

b'Text everybody you know to join you in exercising their constitutional right to protest. Send all your friends a link to register to vote at https://t.co/vhWl2PM2ly. And show up to vote in every election.'
b'So if you\xe2\x80\x99re spending a lot of time hashtagging and posting right now, that\xe2\x80\x99s useful, especially during a pandemic. But it\xe2\x80\x99s only a beginning. Go further.'
b'And if you hold strong with the same faith that carried all those giants before you toward real, measurable progress\xe2\x80\x94you will change the course of history.'

b'Dr. King was angry. Sojourner Truth was angry. Lucretia Mott, Cesar Chavez, the folks at Stonewall\xe2\x80\x94they were all angry.\n\nBut they were also driven by compassion, by principle\xe2\x80\x94by hope.'

b'To anyone who\xe2\x80\x99s feeling invisible: Know that your story matters. Your ideas, your experiences, your vision for our world all matter.\n\nYour anger\xe2\x80\x94that matters too. But left on its own, it will only corrode, destroy, and sow chaos\xe2\x80\x94on the inside and out.'

b'So much has changed so quickly. And if any of you are confused or scared or angry\xe2\x80\x94or just plain overwhelmed\xe2\x80\x94I just want you to know that you aren\xe2\x80\x99t alone. I am feeling all that, too. And I have a few things I want to say about it. https://t.co/kUZeBzC8xP https://t.co/0zOQpEcX9K'

b'As @aliciakeys communicates so beautifully here, like so many of you, I\xe2\x80\x99ve been doing a lot of thinking over the past few weeks. b'It ends with justice, compassion, and empathy that manifests in our lives and on our streets. I pray we all have the strength for that journey, just as I pray for the souls and the families of those who were taken from us.'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s up to all of us\xe2\x80\x94Black, white, everyone\xe2\x80\x94no matter how well-meaning we think we might be, to do the honest, uncomfortable work of rooting it out. It starts with self-examination and listening to those whose lives are different from our own.'
b'Race and racism is a reality that so many of us grow up learning to just deal with. But if we ever hope to move past it, it can\xe2\x80\x99t just be on people of color to deal with it.'
